article:
'Stark' and 'Starke' are predominantly German surnames. Notable people with the
surname include:

*Andrew Stark (born 1964), Australian street photographer
* Anthony Stark (disambiguation), multiple people *Arthur C. Stark (1846-1899),
  British medical doctor and naturalist *Benjamin Stark (1820-1898), American
  merchant and Oregon Senator *Christine Stark (born 1970), Canadian volleyball
  player *David Stark (disambiguation) refers to several people of this name
  *Ethel Stark (born 1916), Canadian violinist and conductor *Etilmon J. Stark
  (1868â1962), American composer and arranger, son of John S. Stark *Freya Stark
  (1893â1993), English traveler and writer about the Middle East *Graham Stark
  (born 1922), English comedian, actor, writer and director *Harold Stark (born
  1939), American mathematician *Harold Rainsford Stark (1880â1972), American
  admiral of the U.S. Navy during WWII *Helen Stark, one of the Perth Martyrs
  *Ian Stark (contemporary), Australian equestrian, Olympic medalist in eventing
  *James Stark (disambiguation) refers to several people of this name,
  including: **James Stark (painter) (1794â1859), British painter *Janne Stark
  (contemporary), Swedish music writer, author and musician *Johannes Stark
  (1874â1957), German physicist, and Nobel Prize laureate *John Stark
  (1728â1822), American general during the American Revolutionary War
* Johnny Stark (talent manager) (1922-1989), French talent manager *John
  Stillwell Stark (1841â1927), American publisher of ragtime music *Juergen
  Stark (born 1948), German central banker *Julian Stryjkowski (Pesach Stark)
  *Koo Stark (born 1956), American actress, model, and photographer *Leonard P.
  Stark (born 1969), American judge *Lloyd C. Stark (1886â1972), American former
  governor of Missouri *Mabel Stark (1889â1968), American circus performer
  *Melissa Stark (born 1973), American television personality *Mike Stark,
  American author, activist, blogger and commentator *Oskar Victorovich Stark
  (1846–1928), Russian vice-admiral *Pete Stark (born 1931), American
  politician, Congressman from California *Ray Stark (1915â2004), American film
  producer *Richard Stark, pseudonym of American writer Donald E. Westlake (born
  1933) *Rodney Stark, American sociologist of religion *Tibor Stark (born
  1972), Hungarian weightlifter *Tony Stark, American superhero Iron Man.
  *William Henry Stark (1851-1936), American businessman *Wolfgang Stark (born
  1969), German football referee *Zoe Stark (contemporary), Australian actress

'Starke' is the surname of: *George Starke (born 1948), American football player
*Peter Burwell Starke (1815-1888), Confederate general in the Civil War *Robert
Starke, Australian ice hockey player *William E. Starke (1814-1862), Confederate
general in the Civil War

As the surname of a fictional character, 'Stark' may refer to: *Eric John Stark,
a character by Leigh Brackett *House Stark, a fictional noble family in A Song
of Ice and Fire *Stark (''Farscape''), a character in Farscape *Tony Stark, the
secret identity of the Marvel Comic's superhero Iron Man *Nathan Stark, a
character in the Eureka universe *Stark (''Bleach''), a character in Bleach
media *Willie Stark, an opera by Carlisle Floyd to his own libretto premiered in
1981 *Willie Stark (character), a character in All the King's Men *George Stark,
a character in [[The Dark Half]] *Deputy District Attorney Sebastian Stark, the
main character in [[Shark (TV series)|Shark]] *Richard Stark, a character
created by Donald E. Westlake *Howard Stark, a character in "Captain America",
premiered in 2011 *Stark, a character in [[Only Forward]], the debut novel from
Michael Marshall Smith in 1994
